message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.NA, cs.SY

The paper deals with the representation of rotations in neural networks, which is a topic that is relevant to several sub-fields of computer science. The most likely category is cs.LG (Machine Learning), as the paper focuses on the suitability of different rotation representations for training deep neural networks. The paper also includes empirical results for several practical problems in graphics and vision, which suggests that it could be relevant to cs.CV (Computer Vision). The paper also discusses topological concepts such as homeomorphism and embedding, which could make it relevant to cs.GR (Graphics) and cs.SY (Systems and Control). Finally, the paper includes mathematical analysis of the continuity of rotation representations, which suggests that it could be relevant to cs.NA (Numerical Analysis).
